Toxoplasmosis :\n\nThe toxoplasmosis is an infectious disease due to a parasite. It can contract by eating poorly cooked contaminated meat, poorly washed raw vegetables or dirty water. Most of the time, it does not cause symptoms and is not serious. However, it sometimes causes fetal complications in non-immunized pregnant women.
Digestive problem
Various

Listeriosis :\n\nThe listeriosis is a bacterial disease that affects many species animal and that is caused by Listeria monocytogenes. The transmission of this disease is basically by the food. Most species are found to be septicemic forms, nerve forms and genital forms. Prevention is based on strict hygiene. Listeriosis is manifested by sepsis, meningitis (or meningoencephalitis), a encephalitis, and intrauterine or cervical infections in pregnant women, which can lead to spontaneous abortion (in the second and third trimesters).

Salmonellosis :

The salmonellosis eis a bacterial infection due to enterobacteriaceae Salmonella, responsible for typhoid or para-typhoid fevers (notifiable diseases), of gastroenteritis, food poisoning.

Most people infected with bacteria from Salmonella genus develop diarrhea, fever, and abdominal cramps within 12 to 48 hours. hours after infection. The illness usually lasts 4 to 7 days and most people recover without treatment.

The elderly, children, pregnant women and those who have diseases causing Immune deficiencies are more likely to contract this form of the disease.
Microbial risks

Listeriosis : \n\nThe listeriosis is a bacterial disease that affects many species animal diseases and that is caused by Listeria monocytogenes. The transmission of this disease is essentially by the food. Most species are found to be septicemic forms, Nerve forms and genital forms. Prevention relies on a strict respect for hygiene. The listeriosis includes sepsis, meningitis (or meningoencephalitis), encephalitis, and intrauterine or cervical infections in pregnant women, which may lead to spontaneous abortion (in the second and third trimesters).

Toxoplasmosis :\n\nThe toxoplasmosis is an infectious disease due to a parasite. It can contract by eating undercooked contaminated meat, poorly washed vegetables or dirty water. Most of the time, it does not cause any symptoms and is not serious. However, it sometimes causes fetal complications in non-immunized pregnant women.
